programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary discovers that lockers can lead to romance at auctions in Riverside. Meanwhile, Dave finds something that leaves him baffled.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid against inexperienced competitors for a vintage fishing seat at a container auction in San Diego.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid against a wealthy opponent in San Diego, and succeed in securing a 1950s baseball machine and a 1980s hydraulic rescue tool.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Poor weather causes trouble for the bargain-hunting bidders as they attend auctions in Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Waxahachie, where wood expert Moe Prigoff meets his match.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a theme park during a clear-out and later discover some shocking news about a collection of circus posters.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: As the final day arrives, the teams race to tag out before sunset, and Troy hopes to retain his crown by catching one last alligator.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: A ferocious feline attacks a farmer's goat herd, and Ernie Brown Jr must capture it before it does more damage. Plus, a group of show dogs is attacked by a foul-smelling skunk.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: A hole-digging critter disrupts the grounds of a farm, and Ernie Brown Jr must capture it so the rancher can train his bull. The turtleman also attempts to relocate some snappers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys interview applicants for the night shift position and examine a valuable first edition of David Thoreau's classic book Walden.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth finds himself in the cross hairs after his new employee makes a big mistake, while Ashley is forced to face one of her most insulting customers yet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: As a storm threatens to knock out the shop's power, Seth hatches an emergency plan - only for it to be shot down by his father.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate strange carvings from 8,000 BC and unexplained sightings in the New World, which could suggest there is more to the US's past than written in the history books.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts join the trail of purported Nazi time travel device, Die Glocke, to try and find out if it really did exist and if it could it have been based on alien technology.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A bidding war erupts between the buyers as they attend the latest round of auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor tries to end his losing streak in Waxahachie, but faces some tough competition.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seth's master plan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The force is strong as the gang encounter a treasure trove of Star Wars related memorabilia, including an original 'Revenge of the Jedi' poster, and a Jabba the Hutt Play-Doh set..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to make a deal on a guitar signed by Crosby, Stills & Nash, and also examines a pair of bomb fins from the Second World War.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In this episode we take a walk down memory lane with the most 'senior' buyer: Barry Weiss. 'The Collector' was always better at turning the auctions into fun than profit, so we look back at his turbocharged thrills, spills and puns... lots of puns..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary makes an early start at an auction in Upland, while Dan and Laura try to make life difficult for their rivals.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones set their sights on an undertaker's tool kit, scuba diving equipment and a shark cage at an auction in Oxnard, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff attends an auction in Ventura County, California, where he spots a vintage suitcase and other items with potential in a unit full of office furniture.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend auctions in a small town where one of the teams acquires a strange wooden box that turns out to have unexpected value.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky is confronted with one of his biggest fears, and Victor gets more than he bargained for when he pursues a motorcycle.

programme.title: Air Crash Special Report
programme.desc: An investigation into five aviation disasters caused by communication failures, and a look at digital air-traffic control systems that harness global positioning satellites to align aircraft more efficiently on their routes.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens Tsoukalos investigates whether sightings of the Loch Ness monster could be caused by a disturbance in the space-time continuum.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate remote ruins, mysterious caves and legendary mountain portals, asking if these alleged stargates have brought ancient aliens to Earth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions are at an all-time high in the store as Seth and Les tussle for power and Ashley intervenes when the chaos begins to affect business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Everyone's eyes are on Seth as he tries to prove he is worthy of being in charge, while also attempting to keep calm as the pressure begins to mount.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth makes a costly mistake that threatens to land the business in financial disaster. While he tries to correct it, Ashley spills the beans to Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les works at breakneck pace to customise a $20,000 ring, but Seth is furious when Ashley unjustifiably derails the sale.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys are excited to find a vintage shuffleboard table and a tanker race car in a unit in Burbank, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys face tough competition at an auction in Alaska, but are hoping a wooden canoe and a percussion hammer they find in their units will earn them a profit.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts question whether the facts of Earth's alien past could be buried in areas that - thanks to warfare or instability - are presently off-limits to exploration.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The secret military aircraft constructed by armed forces in America, South Africa, Russia, Australia and Canada that resemble flying saucers, and have caused a stir with the locals.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: This special episode strolls through the archives of Storage Wars' very own master and apprentice; Darrell and Brandon Sheets. Whether the father and son team is winning big, or busting big, one thing's for sure... for 'The Gambler', profit is just a flip of the coin away..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Locker in the West
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at locker auctions in Santa Ana, where Darrell makes a find that could mean another huge win for the Gambler.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, first aired in June and hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, London Hughes, Rhys James and Milton Jones. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck still leads the pack of five comics, as Russell Howard wraps a tie round his head and Tim Vine is left bereft by a small piece of bent metal.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Crystal Maze host Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with comedian Roisin Conaty and broadcaster Robert Peston joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it, beginning in Belfast, Edinburgh and Whitby.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it, visiting Belfast, Bristol, Newcastle and Glasgow.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Athletes take on daring stunts, with often hilarious results! Inspired by the sport of wakeboarding, Tim and Gendle invent a life-sized game of stone skipping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni's cousin Steph brings a brand new pick-up truck in for a customisation, complete with a full colour change and new bodykit.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike, Frank, Robbie and Danielle all hit the road in search of treasure, to see what the jam-packed yards and barns of Virginia have in store for them.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Alvarado brothers stumble across an interesting collectible, while Brandon and Lori bid on a storage facility for pets.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse and the Alvarado brothers get devious, while a frustrated Brandon and Lori look as if they might end up leaving the auction empty-handed.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May revisit their bid to build amphibious vehicles, and face one of their toughest challenges yet. The Audi R8 takes to the track and Jools Holland tests his driving ability as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill, as it arrives in Paris.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than £1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of £3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Tim Vine attempts a risky impersonation, Alex Horne receives a gift from Liza Tarbuck, and the recipient of the Taskmaster's golden bonce trophy is revealed.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Writer-presenter Clive Anderson, The One Show host Alex Jones and actor-comedian Jack Whitehall compete to have their pet hates banished on the lively panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include British-themed bars in foreign countries, shared tables, deer, seagulls and metrosexuality.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former BBC Breakfast presenter Bill Turnbull, Death in Paradise star Ben Miller and comedienne Jo Brand compete to have their pet hates banished on the light-hearted panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include middle-lane drivers, personalised number plates, low-slung jeans and homeopathy.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian, writer and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with stand-up Ross Noble and journalist Mona Chalabi joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and asks a range of unusual questions about journeys, finding out how much Rob Brydon, Phill Jupitus, Cal Wilson and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the subject.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten falls head over heels in love with Camille, a female mechanoid rescued from a crashed vessel. However, the object of his desire is not all she appears to be. Starring Robert Llewellyn, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The crew finds a machine capable of transforming the shape of any living thing by altering its genetic make-up, a discovery resulting in a desperate fight for survival. Starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Chris Kamara asks Jon to take part in a Leeds United fundraiser for deprived children. While he's away Lucy tries to enrol Elsie in a private school - against Jon's wishes.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Tim Vine attempts a risky impersonation, Alex Horne receives a gift from Liza Tarbuck, and the recipient of the Taskmaster's golden bonce trophy is revealed.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Hitler's launch of his great counter-offensive against the unsuspecting Allies in the Ardennes. This was the Nazis' last gamble in the West to turn the tide of the war.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the staff of Moses, one of the more astonishing miracles depicted in the Bible as Moses turned his staff into a snake.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day examines the 1949 murder of wealthy widow Olive Durand, and the gruesome confession made by the man who was brought in for questioning.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When De Gaulle Chose War
programme.desc: Charles De Gaulle's refusal to surrender to the German invasion of France in 1940, and his subsequent escape to London and establishment of a French government in exile.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Hitler's launch of his great counter-offensive against the unsuspecting Allies in the Ardennes. This was the Nazis' last gamble in the West to turn the tide of the war.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. Using the latest diving technology to explore the South-West's deep-sea wrecks.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When Roosevelt Chose War
programme.desc: The United States' entry into the Second World War following the attack on Pearl Harbor, focusing on Roosevelt's decision to engage German forces as well as Japanese.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: The Allies reached the last great natural barrier between their forces and the German heartland. If they could get across the River Rhine, the war would be won.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Aircraft restoration expert Mark Masters and his son James rebuild a 1943 US Army Aeronca Defender liaison plane for its German owner.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: Dave and Steve spot something special at auction, but they're not the only ones on the trail of this First World War pilot's logbook.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A millionaire businessman is found dead a year after his disappearance. Evidence suggests he was imprisoned in a cellar immediately before his death, and it's not long before a second body is discovered at the scene. The other corpse has been dead for far longer - and it seems both murders could be the work of an unlikely suspect.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Lack of Control - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack officially opens the newly rebuilt station, while Adam's grief at the loss of his entire family in a fatal car crash is compounded by suggestions that wife Denise drove through a red light while talking on her mobile phone. Phil tempts fate by flirting with Samantha, while Suzie monitors a recently released child abuser, but makes the mistake of contacting his daughter - who is so distressed that she attempts suicide shortly afterwards.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: An expectant mother on her way to hospital is involved in a major traffic accident, and Pearce finds himself acting as a midwife.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers find themselves stuck in Kenya's Makindi province, struggling to find a safe pick up point. Meanwhile, Dave and Donna are unsure about their future together.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy announces he is planning to marry his girlfriend, but is surprised at his friends' response. Meanwhile, Cate Hobbs receives bad news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Lack of Control - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack officially opens the newly rebuilt station, while Adam's grief at the loss of his entire family in a fatal car crash is compounded by suggestions that wife Denise drove through a red light while talking on her mobile phone. Phil tempts fate by flirting with Samantha, while Suzie monitors a recently released child abuser, but makes the mistake of contacting his daughter - who is so distressed that she attempts suicide shortly afterwards.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra returns to Holby with his nephew, who needs an urgent transplant. Ric is unable to operate because of the injury to his hand - but he relents when the patient's mother reveals a secret. Owen fears he might get sacked for hitting Amy's stepfather, thereby jeopardising his access to Katie. Diane tries to keep Laura from turning on her ex, but when she learns about his clandestine relationship with Chrissie, tragedy strikes.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean faces a tough time as an injured fireman and his pregnant girlfriend land him with a moral dilemma. Penny helps Josh cope with his gambling addiction and George has a bad day as increasing pressure from Max forces her to burn the midnight oil. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson, Gerald Kyd and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry races to Ramani's house, where an increasingly unbalanced Margaret Barnes is planning to commit suicide - only to be stabbed and critically injured while attempting to wrest a knife from her. Smithy takes JT to task for spreading gossip around the station, while Dan and Tony try to track down an inventive graffiti artist who uses cleaning products to produce negative images on dirty walls around Sun Hill. It's certainly a novel approach - but does it really constitute a crime?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Phil's infatuation with each other is starting to affect the pub and garage as they are devoting more time to each other rather then their work.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil visits Grant in prison and tells him Ricky is going off to work for Frank. Aiden learns he may not be able to play again.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Ariadne pleads with Nick to marry her, Billy is setting Kevin up with Tina, and it seems Patty and Hallam might be hitting it off. Later, a policeman is stuck in a muddy pool.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: As everyone comes to terms with the shocking events, Lexie fears Hector's dire prediction may come true and the wedding will be jinxed. Her anxieties are increased when her mother arrives at Glenbogle in dramatic fashion, immediately treading on Molly's toes by taking control. Alastair Mackenzie, Dawn Steele and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David plans a surprise party for Karen's 40th birthday, even though she'd rather not bother, and Anna rekindles her romance with Simon now he's returned from Australia a single man once more. Jess is devastated to receive disappointing A level results, meaning she can't get away from home, and newcomers the Morecroft family arrive in Skelthwaite, hoping to shake off their tragic past.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie ensures Aveline and her first granddaughter are brought home in style. Leonora continues to fascinate the Boswell boys.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The mystery of the body in the swimming pool continues. Anxious not to alarm the guests, Clive orders the pool lights to be turned off so that the corpse cannot be seen - but instead Fred and the Yellowcoats plunge the whole camp into darkness.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch helps an Italian detective recover a shipload of stolen antiquities and Brackenreid considers shipping out altogether.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The medic investigates the death of a strangled young gypsy girl, and must tread carefully as prejudice rears its head. Drama, starring Craig MacLachlan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The appeal of a man convicted of murder and mutilation forces Grace to question the decision she made on the case 30 years ago. Someone who appears to be copying his chilling tactics sends the team footage of a new victim having his finger cut off. At the same time, Grace receives threats and a macabre package - a jar of pickled, severed fingers. Sue Johnston and Trevor Eve star.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: As the investigation takes a shocking turn, secrets rise to the surface. When Andrew was living in Edinburgh, a strange turn of events brought him face to face with an old acquaintance, whose deeply corrosive influence becomes clear. Meanwhile, the tragic recent history of Laura's family helps explain the deep bond she and Katy share, as well as the lengths Laura will go to for those she loves. Will her past catch up with her, just as Andrew's did? Thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Today's mystery host is football legend Peter Shilton. Will the diners tackle his cunning clues and walk off with the cash or can the famous goalie save himself from the dreaded dishes? Presented by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The funeral industry is worth more than two billion pounds, but are people paying too much for funerals? Sonali Shah investigates.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Jay McGuiness and Kimberley Walsh discuss their roles in the musical adaptation of Sleepless in Seattle. Plus, a lively mix of news and current affairs, health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis, in which a family of five from Cambridgeshire answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Simon, Angela, Karen and Ben work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Brenda starts to panic, Lucas plays up with Dawn, and Will is anxious.

programme.title: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens (2015)
programme.desc: A stormtrooper fighting for an evil regime turns against his masters. He joins forces with a desert scavenger, and together they are drawn into the search for legendary war hero Luke Skywalker, who disappeared years previously. Meanwhile, a terrible weapon is about to be unleashed, that will allow the forces of evil to dominate the galaxy once again. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Daisy Ridley, John Boyega, Harrison Ford and Adam Driver.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The techniques used in surfing deadly waves, and how the Arizona Cardinals' NFL stadium is transformed into a monster-truck venue in just 48 hours.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China struggle to agree on the definition of a real sports car, prompting Mike to head out in search of the perfect example - bringing home a 1968 Corvette.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie miners Justin and Daniel tread a dangerous path deep underground in an abandoned mine. Meanwhile, Kelly and Al search for a rare, valuable black opal.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The crew visits Howe Caverns to explore some caves, and Paul Teutul Jr continues working as a consultant, focusing on his own projects away from the shop.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: A 1968 Corvette is brought in for mechanical work, but what the car really needs is a new paint job. When it's time to drive it, it proves to be half the car Jim was hoping for.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unappealing tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as the series reveals how membrane filters, bridge ties, and bi-planes are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind hospital laundry and horse replicas are revealed.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the axe was first forged. The programme also observes a messenger bag get cut, sew, stitched and glued together and reveals how the fastest lifeboats are built.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien repurposes some old suitcases, while Henry Cole gives an old dresser some serious bling.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews hear rumours of prime fishing near the ice pack, and a race begins to see who can reach the area first, but the long hours and adverse conditions gradually begin to take their toll on the men.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: The fleet scrambles for its last pans of gold as the ice season comes to an end, and while some captains meet their goals, others continue to struggle.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie miners Justin and Daniel tread a dangerous path deep underground in an abandoned mine. Meanwhile, Kelly and Al search for a rare, valuable black opal.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer spends more than £2,000 on a 1984 Corvette C4, leaving it up to Edd China to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the restoration project, Mike Brewer has the 1984 Corvette C4 valued ready for selling.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini tracks down a Ferrari 275 GTB4 in Boston and takes a spin in an original 275 in California.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini explores coachbuilder Steve Moal's collection of one-off cars and bids on a classic DKW at auction. He also asks Laurence Anderson for help when he has problems with his Bentley.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien repurposes some old suitcases, while Henry Cole gives an old dresser some serious bling.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.desc: Flooding forces the crew of the Alaska Ranger to abandon ship in frigid waters off the coast of Alaska, setting off a massive rescue effort by the coastguard.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Delirium sets in among the crews several weeks into the opilio season, resulting in deadly mistakes being made - and one fisherman receives word of a family tragedy back on land while he is at sea.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: With more dredges than ever headed for one small lease, and the price of gold plunging, the teams realise that the competition is going to be tougher than ever before.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits an upmarket Somerset showroom and buys a scruffy table full of potential. In Lancashire, he spots a Swedish design classic and a Soviet relic of the Cold War.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Mick Cooke's mining operation grinds to a halt when the conveyor belt rips on a vital piece of machinery. In a desperate need for cash, Mick heads out of town on another job.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China struggle to agree on the definition of a real sports car, prompting Mike to head out in search of the perfect example - bringing home a 1968 Corvette.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including stained glass and a Victorian hay rack that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: After discovering a 1700s-era cannon, Darrell seeks the ship's origin. Meanwhile, a letter in Gordon's files details a 16th-century wreck connected to Sir Francis Drake.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: Experts recreate Houdini's escape from a Siberian prison van, which some believed was a conspiracy to spy for the US government.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the space shuttles were launched, and the technology that allows the world's most extreme rollercoasters to be built. Plus, how pool tables are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Empire State Building/Extracting Copper/Making a Car
programme.desc: How the mast on top of the Empire State Building is repaired, and the techniques involved in extracting copper from the world's largest mine.

programme.title: Women Behind Bars with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part one of two. The veteran broadcaster follows life inside two prisons holding some of America's most notorious female criminals - Indiana Women's Prison and Rockville Correctional Facility in the same US state. Among the inmates he meets in the first edition are Sarah Pender, who went on the run while serving 110 years for double murder, before being captured four months later, and Martha Search, who is looking forward to getting to grips with modern technology when her 20-year sentence comes to an end.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The case of a missing Californian teenager, who was presumed to have run away. However, her body turned up in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the police recover a submerged car belonging to a man reported missing, they are perturbed to discover a pair of broken glasses on the floor but no body.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Black Hat
programme.desc: The murder of student Julissa Brisman, found shot and bound in a hotel room in Boston. Police used cameras to find her killer and were shocked by what they uncovered.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a loving couple were gunned down and killed. A cryptic message found scrawled across the pair's bedroom wall led police to suspect the crime was drug related, though the victims had no obvious involvement in such an illegal trade.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How scientists traced the murderer of 12-year-old Polly Klaas, who was snatched from her home during a slumber party by a stranger. Laser technology detected a normally invisible palm print, and fibres collected from the scene were eventually matched to the killer, enabling a conviction.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The prosecution of an owner of a pair of pit bull terriers suffering from severe mange is considered, while a starving and dehydrated puppy is rescued. Plus, investigators have to break things up when two pit bulls attack each other.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Rescue dog Benji's heart problem concerns Dr Chris, and Smudge the cat's injuries shock Lisa, who hopes surgeons can reconstruct the animal's leg. Tim helps out some alligators.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Daisy tries on a dress that is twice her budget, while Donna is overwhelmed by her father's generosity.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Emily arrives with only two days until her sky-high vow renewal. Meanwhile, Olympic athlete Queen Harrison faces hurdles about her dress decision.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An unusual patient turns up in the form of an albino echidna, and Chris is invited to Symbio Wildlife Park to carry out a highly dangerous procedure on a female Sumatran tiger.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Harriet the Bearded Dragon has a worrying lump on the side of her leg that requires an urgent operation, and a sick 10-week-old puppy is put in danger by her protective owner.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Mark tries to catch two aggressive untamed cats in a hoarder's house full of more than 60 felines. Kelley rescues a German shepherd puppy with an unhealthy appetite for rocks.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Tempers fray as Mark meets aggressive dogs and home-owners to educate them about a new law making it illegal to keep a dog on a chain when temperatures hit over 100 degrees.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how a murder can be solved by simple scraps of evidence such as dirt on shoes or a small piece of plastic.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Connecticut man Angel Garcia who went missing in October 2011 after riding his dirt bike. Friends claimed he was chased by an sport utility vehicle before he vanished. Several months later, a possible sighting raised hopes.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Macin Smith. When the 17-year-old failed to return from school, his parents feared for his safety and a note hidden in his wallet increased their torment.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: When arrested for historic sexual offences, TV weatherman Fred Talbot tried to hide the truth in police interviews. However, his repeated response of 'no comment' spoke volumes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A former beauty queen wants to put her old style behind her, while a woman getting married for the second time wants a gown that will be the centre of attention.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride who grew up in a children's home had to share clothes with the other kids, so wants something very special for her own wedding dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer wants to look like a princess, but her aunt would prefer a more grown-up look. A woman renewing her wedding vows seeks a perfect dress for the occasion.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: A Dress with a Fighting Chance
programme.desc: A former soldier stands up to family and friends regarding her wedding dress, while a bride picks a gown in honour of her godfather.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bodybuilder wants a dress that shows off her muscles, and a sporty bride is pressured into a more glamorous look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer visits the shop who is getting married later that day and needs a dress immediately.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan is visited by renowned snooker player and commentator Willie Thorne who wants to do a deal on an original artwork, and a world champion Thai boxer hopes to pawn three of his championship belts. At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, Nathan and assistant Deb test-drive an ice-cream van that owner Sam wishes to sell, and Tom has a diamond ring he wants to dispose of.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Doctors Christian Jessen, Dawn Harper and Pixie McKenna deal with the impact obesity can have on fertility, and excess hair caused by polycystic ovaries. There is also advice for a man concerned about the size of his chest.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: When an accidental death in upstate New York becomes a possible murder scene, a wife and mother provide a crucial piece of evidence as a dark truth is revealed.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: The murder of the mother of US soap star Thom Bierdz by his youngest brother Troy. The sibling used a baseball bat to commit the act.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of Tanveer Iqbal. Spurned mistress Zatoon Bibi was jailed for life after being found guilty of killing her lover and putting his body in the boot of his car.
